info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 20 at 1:00AM CDT until June 20 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN BURLEIGH AND NORTHEASTERN MORTON COUNTIES... At 1259 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bismarck, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 1254 AM CDT, a mesonet station reported a 68 mph wind gust 2 miles south of Mandan. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Bismarck, Mandan, Lincoln, Menoken, Mcdowell Dam Recreation Area, Fort Abraham Lincoln State Park and University Of Mary. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
